title: Paulista
text:
Paulista is a <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Brazil">municipality</a> in <a href="Pernambuco">Pernambuco</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>, with a population of 334,376 as of 2020. It has the highest <a href="Human%20Development%20Index">Human Development Index</a> (HDI) of the <a href="Recife%20metropolitan%20area">Recife metropolitan area</a>. It is the birthplace of footballer <a href="Rivaldo">Rivaldo</a> and is also famous for its beaches, including Maria Farinha with the giant <a href="Veneza%20water%20park">Veneza water park</a>. It was incorporated as a city in 1935.
The land on which the city is built was sold to a <a href="bandeirante">bandeirante</a> from <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo">São Paulo</a> in 1689, whence the city's name.
Beaches.
The beaches of Paulista are a nesting ground for endangered <a href="hawksbill%20sea%20turtle">hawksbill sea turtle</a>s.
Economy.
The main economic activities in Paulista are based in commerce, tourism and textile industry.
